title: A brief history of the life of Mary, Queen of Scots, and the occasions that brought her and Thomas, Duke of Norfolk, to their tragical ends shewing the hopes the Papists then had of a Popish successor in England, and their plots to accomplish them : with a full account of the tryals of that Queen, and of the said Duke, as also the trial of Philip Howard, Earl of Arundel : from the papers of a secretary of Sir Francis Walsingham / now published by a person of quality.
author: M. D.
notes: Attributed to Sir Francis Walsingham. Cf. Halkett and Laing.
Attributed to M.D. by Wing and BM.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
